net.sf.microlog.util
Class Properties

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.microlog.util.Properties
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertiesGetter
public class Properties
extends java.lang.Object
implements PropertiesGetter

A class that makes the properties available to the system. The properties are based on key/value, i.e: some.key=some_value The properties are taken from the following sources in this order. (That is, the values have precedence in this order.) Sources: -------- - default values - property text-file included in the JAR-file - values from application properties (MIDlet.getAppProperty) - values saved in rms (Example: keys/values saved in the rms overwrites keys/values from all other sources.)

Author:
Darius Katz

Constructor Detail

Properties

public Properties()
Creates a new properties object. Since no midlet is passed as a parameter properties will not come from the application properties.

getDefaultValue

public java.lang.Object getDefaultValue(java.lang.String key)
Returns the Object to which the specified key is mapped directly from the default values. Any overridden settings are ignored. Useful if an overridden value is erroneous and a proper value is needed. (The default values are considered to be checked and therefore proper.)

Specified by:
getDefaultValue in interface PropertiesGetter
Parameters:
key - the key associated to the stored Object
Returns:
the Object to which the key is mapped; null if the key is not mapped to any Object in this hashtable.
